intro: Cakile clavata, commonly known as the clustered rockcress, is a flowering plant species native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many plants with distinctive cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Its leaves are basal and lobed, while its flowers are small and white or pink in color. Cakile clavata is adapted to harsh conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
